channel.title: Anyone who has experience in Tom's Cache Suite
channel.description: I want to import a new image onto the client through the cache suite editor but .jag, .png, .gif - Everything does not load transparency. When I export on of the files it shows up as a .file format (wtf) is there any way I can load an image that retains its transparency?

item.title: Anyone who has experience in Tom's Cache Suite
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Edit: It didn’t work perfectly, the icon retained it’s pink background. Any ideas?

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone who has experience in Tom's Cache Suite

item.title: Anyone who has experience in Tom's Cache Suite
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

you have to use that pink color, thats what the client sees as transparent.

heres an example:

item.title: Anyone who has experience in Tom's Cache Suite
item.dc:creator: @wohuynia wohuynia
item.description:
@wohuynia wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:3, topic:340972”][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=437366.msg3213982#msg3213982 date=1274543873]

I want to import a new image onto the client through the cache suite editor but .jag, .png, .gif - Everything does not load transparency. When I export on of the files it shows up as a .file format (wtf) is there any way I can load an image that retains its transparency?

backround eraser on photoshop
[/quote]

Used it and when the background was removed in .png format, it showed black.[/quote]
send me the image that you want to edit, ill see what i can do ;DD

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone who has experience in Tom's Cache Suite

item.title: Anyone who has experience in Tom's Cache Suite
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:2, topic:340972”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=437366.msg3213962#msg3213962 date=1274542388]
I want to import a new image onto the client through the cache suite editor but .jag, .png, .gif - Everything does not load transparency. When I export on of the files it shows up as a .file format (wtf) is there any way I can load an image that retains its transparency?
[/quote]

backround eraser on photoshop[/quote]

Used it and when the background was removed in .png format, it showed black.

Read full topic
